title: CSE Sem 4 subjects
content: What subjects do we have in sem 4 of cse?

comments.body:
(5creds)

Microprocessors and computer architecture 
Computer networks 

(4 creds)

Operating systems
Design and analysis of algorithms 
Linear algebra 

(2creds- not sure if u guys also have this,afaik some CIE stuff has be made compulsory)
Special topics- cpp/golang/ and few other similar topics
A bit of extra info: CIE L1 and L2 were actually considered as special topics you could opt for. So you still have 2 credits of special topic, it's just that your choice is already decided lmao
Ooooo send Golang syllabus if you have something pls

My bad,You guys won't be getting to choose special topics, it's a compulsory CIE L2 course for y'all as mentioned by Rowlie Anna 

I wasn't aware of CIE-L2 being compulsory.

The person you're referring to as "y'all" is Rowlet Anna's friend and classmate lmao. FYI, google "PESU CSE notes GitHub" and you'll find a repository their notes that helped everyone in the 2022 batch pass ESAs. 

u/abaksy look how they've massacred you :(

Oh I'm really sorry

I didn't realise it's Aronya Annaüôèüèº
Issok lmao, I wanted only because I worked with Go for 2 years and I have an interest in distributed systems (Go is also one of my favourite languages üôÇ)

Oh okayy, this was the syllabus for our batch
